skillTree.name: Empire Warhorse
skillTree.description: The finest steed freshly imported to the City-State of Marienburg.

skillTree.name: Kawaru
skillTree.description: Gifted by a rather mysterious trader, Kawaru is Egmond's personal guardian and longma.

skillTree.name: Haeyndrik's Shield
skillTree.description: The god of money, wealth and power protects it's patrons with a shield of coins.

skillTree.name: Lore of Tsien-Tsin
skillTree.description: Those who give in to Tsien-Tsin's call unlock the secrets of their future.

skillTree.name: Feathers of Conversion
skillTree.description: Tsien-Tsin's mutations are slow, starting with subtle colourful feathers growing from it's worshippers arms and legs. It's the start of a much more grander conversion.

skillTree.name: Renowned Jewelers
skillTree.description: The Den Euwe family is specialized in the jewelry trade. Having more expertise on gem value than most Dwarven holds.

skillTree.name: Alchemical Linchpin
skillTree.description: Egmond is a talented alchemist, learning mixing potions and ingredients from a very young age on the buzzling market of Marienburg's Potion Square.

skillTree.name: Eastern Oddities
skillTree.description: No other house has more connections in Cathay as House Den Euwe, having longstanding relations with merchants from Hanyu to Beichai. The result is a steady stream of valueable Eastern Oddities.

effects.description:
Allegiance points gained: +30% for alliances with Cathay
	(factionwide)

skillTree.name: Art of Warfare
skillTree.description: Adventuring from a very young age Egmond has more fighting experience as his looks might suggest.

skillTree.name: Orange Simca's Blessing
skillTree.description: Nipponese Nobles often pay tribute to their mythical God Orange Simca by offering it the colourfully painted skulls of their own ancestors. The more frivolous, the more boons.

effects.description: Changing of the Ways cooldown: -1 turns

skillTree.name: Handelaarsmarkt
skillTree.description: House Den Euwe has it's headquarters on the Handelaarsmarkt in Marienburg, their influence there is rivalled only by the Van de Kuypers.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +15% for Marienburg Privateers, Sartosa Militia and Free Company Militia
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +15% for Marienburg Privateers, Sartosa Militia and Free Company Militia
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Brew of the Divine Sun
skillTree.description: Den Euwe's are famed alchemists, brewing diverse potions with all sorts of effects. Faith will have it this particular batch will change you forever.

effects.description:
Ability: "Concoction of Change" for Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

enabled_if: Unit vigour is worse than tired

skillTree.name: Way of the Cathayans
skillTree.description: Having spent so much of his young life among the Cathayans, Egmond has adapted their ways of balance and clarity.

effects.description:
Passive: Battle Harmony: Yang for Marienburg melee units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.description: Activates when within 60 metres of a Yin unit.
Effect intensity increases by highest nearby Harmony multiplier on a unit.

effects.description:
Attribute: Yang to Marienburg melee units
	(Lord's army)

Passive: Battle Harmony: Yin for Marienburg ranged units
	(Lord's army)

ui_effects.description: Activates when within 60 metres of a Yang unit.
Effect intensity increases by highest nearby Harmony multiplier on a unit.

effects.description:
Attribute: Yin to Marienburg ranged units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Blue fire of Tsien-Tsin
skillTree.description: Give in to change as one is submerged by Tsien-Tsin's fire.

ui_effects.description: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Blue Fire of Tsien-Tsin"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Blue Fire of Tsien-Tsin Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Blue Fire of Tsien-Tsin Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Change is Freedom
skillTree.description: Once Tsien-Tsin's secrets are unlocked one is truly liberated.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Freedom of Tsien-Tsin"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Freedom of Tsien-Tsin Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Freedom of Tsien-Tsin Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.name: Tsien-Tsin's Storm
skillTree.description: Blistering balls of scarlet flame emanate from the spellcaster to engulf the foe in deadly balefire.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Tsien-Tsin's Firestorm"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Tsien-Tsin's Firestorm Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Tsien-Tsin's Firestorm Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Emperor's Finest
skillTree.description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.name: Speed of Horse
skillTree.description: These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.

skillTree.name: Pistolkorps
skillTree.description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

skillTree.name: Honest Steel
skillTree.description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

skillTree.name: Mighty Forge
skillTree.description: Patrons of great forges and smiths expect, and are rewarded with, tougher and more enduring war machines.

skillTree.name: Imperial Gunnery
skillTree.description: Despite what the Dwarfs think, no other race can bring to bear such devastating artillery volleys.

skillTree.name: Strength of Hardship
skillTree.description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

skillTree.name: Sharpshooter
skillTree.description: The veteran marksman knows the precise range required to land the killing shot.

skillTree.name: Taste for Battle
skillTree.description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

Melee attack: +5 for Greatswords, Halberdiers, Reiksguard, Sons of Manann, Knights of the Blazing Sun, Knights Mariner, Knights of the Cleansing Flame, and Demigryph Knights units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Artillery Master
skillTree.description: Those in command of ordnance can potentially decide a battle before the melee has even begun.

skillTree.name: Route Marcher
skillTree.description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

skillTree.name: Iron Disciplinarian
skillTree.description: This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.

skillTree.name: Leader of Renown
skillTree.description: Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.

skillTree.name: Reassuring Presence
skillTree.description: The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Fervent
skillTree.description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.

skillTree.name: Irrepressible
skillTree.description: It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Quartermaster
skillTree.description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.

skillTree.name: Logistician
skillTree.description: Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.

skillTree.name: Alert
skillTree.description: Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.name: Headhunter
skillTree.description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

backgroundSkills.name: Den Euwe's Pride
backgroundSkills.description: Young, ambitious, gifted with magic and talented with words. Egmond is ready to sail the four corners and establish his family name, among other things he seeks to establish.

effects.description:
Immune to attrition
	(all units in army)

ui_effects.description: Requires line of sight to the target

items.name: Tsien-Tsin's Golden Amulet
items.description: Not long after Egmond den Euwe arrived in Cathay, coming from the familiar streets of Marienburg's Handelaarsmarkt, he stumbled upon a robed vendor. This merchant convinced Egmond to trade a Den Euwe heirloom for this bejeweld amulet. Egmond, schooled in jewelry in true Den Euwe fashion, the young merchant recognized this amulet's worth. Solid gold with a completely smooth eye made out of solid marble. After the trade, Egmond did not remove the trinket from his neck once. The longer he wears it, the firmer the rumour spreads amongst his men - that the eye watches you and followes all movement it feasts it's vision on.

items.name: Himari Yamada
items.description: On his travels, Egmond met with a young Nipponese merchant named Himari Yamada. Like the Den Euwe offspring, she too hails from the mysterious isles. She states she we was part of a noble line living on the island of the Tower of the Rising Sun. This region is famous for it's rice bowls, not just a culinary tradition of Nippon, it has far reaching utilities including invigorating and motivating friendly troops. In exchange for safety, she offers to share her secret recipe.

items.name: Okumoto's Katana
items.description: Son to Lady Katsi Okumoto the young Egmond wields the Okumoto's heirloom. A thin long blade known by the Nipponese as a katana. Forged by these mysterious island dwellers, the katana blade is said to be even lighter than Elven blades. Allowing the wielder to swing with verocious speed without losing precision. The heirloom is engraved with dragons and exotic symbols, making it a true sight to behold. It's beauty only matched by it's deadliness.

factionEffects.title: House Den Euwe Enclave
factionEffects.description: On a desperate attempt to prevent House Den Euwe's bankruptcy, Egmond scours the Cathayan shores in search of trade - all he finds however, is the watchful gaze of Tsien-Tsin, corrupting him with visions of false knowledge.

effects.description: This is a minor faction, experiences may differ from playing with a major faction.
Convert mortal men to Tzeentch units using the warband upgrade system (Requires DLC)
Has access to Changing of the Ways
Send trade convoys across the world via the Gilded Route and navigate risks en route to reap great financial rewards
Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn
